agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Homeland Security & Public Safety TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, April 17, 2019 PLACE: E2.016 CHAIR: Rep. Poncho Nevárez ****THERE WILL BE A 2 MINUTE LIMIT ON TESTIMONY**** THE ORDER IN WHICH BILLS ARE HEARD IS AT THE DISCRETION OF THE CHAIR. IF YOU INTEND TO TESTIFY, PLEASE REGISTER AT ONE OF THE KIOSKS IN THE BACK HALL. HB 838 Deshotel | et al. Relating to an agreement between the Department of Public Safety and a private vendor for the issuance of renewal and duplicate driver's licenses and other identification certificate services; authorizing a fee. HB 1938 Deshotel Relating to the expiration date of a commercial driver's license; increasing a fee. HB 2478 Deshotel Relating to driver's licenses, commercial driver's licenses, and other identification certificates; authorizing and increasing fees. HB 409 White | et al. Relating to driver's licensing requirements for minors. HB 1013 White Relating to repealing automatic driver's license suspensions for certain drug offenses. HB 34 Raymond | et al. Relating to a statewide disaster alert system. HB 107 Raymond Relating to the dissemination of criminal history record information by the Department of Public Safety concerning certain intoxication criminal offenses. HB 2949 Guillen | et al. Relating to a license to carry a handgun for a person who is at increased risk of becoming a victim of violence. HB 842 Hernandez | et al. Relating to a central database containing information about offenders who have committed certain violent offenses against children or offenses involving family or dating violence. HB 2931 Parker | et al. Relating to the issuance of a driver's license by an entity other than the Department of Public Safety. HB 646 Raney Relating to the operation and inspection of mopeds; increasing a fee. HB 1791 Krause Relating to the carrying of handguns by license holders on property owned or leased by a governmental entity. HB 2604 Sanford Relating to the number of emissions inspections performed by certain vehicle inspection stations. HB 1090 Bell, Cecil | et al. Relating to the definition of first responder. HB 3526 Rose Relating to the duties of and training for certain officers and jailers regarding the child safety check alert list. HB 2607 King, Ken Relating to checkpoints established by the Department of Public Safety at roadways entering this state from New Mexico or Oklahoma. HB 2328 Metcalf Relating to the training requirements for and the expiration of a school marshal license issued or renewed by the Texas Commission on Law Enforcement. HB 418 VanDeaver Relating to the availability of personal information of a current or former federal prosecutor. HB 4428 Tinderholt Relating to the application and eligibility for and expiration of a license to carry a handgun. HB 3858 Johnson, Jarvis Relating to an employment termination report submitted by a law enforcement agency. HB 653 Neave Relating to voluntary contributions to the evidence testing grant program made when applying for a corrected or duplicate driver's license, commercial driver's license, or personal identification certificate. HB 738 Harless Relating to the entry of certain bond conditions into the Texas Crime Information Center. HB 1713 Ramos | et al. Relating to requiring a person convicted of an offense involving family violence or a felony or a person who is the subject of a protective order to surrender firearms owned by the person. HB 2405 Bowers Relating to education and training for peace officers regarding trauma-informed techniques to facilitate interactions with homeless individuals. HB 3138 Bowers Relating to reporting of incidents of sexual harassment, sexual assault, dating violence, and stalking on state property. HB 4469 Meza Relating to the establishment of a grant program and task force relating to disaster issues affecting persons who are elderly and persons with disabilities. HB 2144 Turner, John Relating to peace officer instruction on veterans affected by trauma. HB 2672 Zwiener Relating to a study conducted by the Department of Public Safety on the investigation and prosecution of sexual assault offenses. HB 2678 Zwiener Relating to the compilation and reporting of statistics involving sexual assault victims who receive a forensic medical examination before reporting the assault to law enforcement. HB 257 Blanco Relating to a policy requiring public and private primary and secondary schools and public junior colleges to provide local law enforcement agencies certain information regarding certain individuals authorized to carry a handgun on a campus. HB 2644 Martinez Relating to the notification of a peace officer through an indication associated with vehicle registration that a person has a health condition that may impede communication. HB 3566 Farrar Relating to the forensic examination of a victim of an alleged strangulation assault or sexual assault. HB 3030 Flynn Relating to the reporting of certain information for purposes of a federal firearm background check. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills deleted after last posting: HB 745 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
